feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 4:47AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and Strong Winds Monday and Tuesday... The Arctic coast from Prudhoe Bay east will see between 3 and 5 inches of accumulating snow on Monday and Tuesday. Strong east winds of 30 to 35 mph will blow this falling snow and could temporarily result in periods of low visibility. Use caution when traveling.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 07 at 7:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Another Round of Snow Tonight Through Sunday Night... Much of the Eastern Interior will have 2 to 4 inches of snow tonight through Sunday night. Areas along the Alaska Range near Denali Park could have up to 6 inches of snow. Northeast winds gusting to 20 mph will cause blowing and drifting snow in many areas late tonight and Sunday. Passes and Highway Summits will

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 4:11AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER DANGER TODAY... Very dry conditions on top of ongoing drought will lead to elevated fire weather danger today. While not quite meeting red flag criteria due to lighter winds than yesterday, burning is still not recommended.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 2:59AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING FOR CENTRAL GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES... Relative Humidities of 25 percent or less can be expected for 4 or more hours this afternoon into the evening. Winds will be NW at 5 to 10 MPH with gusts up to 15 MPH. With dry fuels, high fire danger conditions can be expected.

entry.title: Typhoon Watch issued October 08 at 8:56PM ChST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...TROPICAL STORM BOLAVEN MOVING WEST TOWARDS THE MARIANAS... .NEW INFORMATION... The latest forecast track for Tropical Storm Bolaven has shifted slightly north with a passage favored to be near to slightly north of Rota. However, tropical storm to typhoon conditions are still possible for all of the Mariana Islands.
